publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5046 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Children in Need Abroad—That the Parliament notes the forthcoming Children in Need appeal on BBC television; notes that 30,000 children worldwide die each day due to poverty; further notes that infant and child mortality has been considerably slower during the last 25 years than in the previous two decades and that progress in education also slowed during the past 25 years; acknowledges that the number of children in the world is 2.2 billion and that 1 billion, every second child, live in poverty; further notes that, of the 1.9 billion children from the developing world, there are 640 million, one in three, without adequate shelter, 400 million, one in five, with no access to safe water and 270 million, one in seven, with no access to health services; notes that there are 121 million children worldwide out of education; further notes that 1.4 million children die each year from lack of access to safe drinking water and adequate sanitation; recognises that, worldwide, 2.2 million children die each year because they are not immunised and that 15 million children have been orphaned due to HIV/AIDS, and calls on the Scottish Executive to do everything in its power to address child poverty worldwide, including extending aid programmes such as that in Malawi and putting pressure on the UK Government to cancel the debt of developing countries.
S2M-5046 Children in Need Abroad (lodged on 30 October 2006) Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Adam Ingram*
